metadata.synopsis: Halsin meets with Kagha after returning to the grove. He chastises her for her actions during his absence. Depending on Kagha's demeanour, he may soften his tone or not.They disperse after this dialog.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. Blow the horn and side with the tieflings (kill all goblin).5. goto 260.71, 14.82, 523.326. talk with Halsin.

62.speaker: Halsin
62.text: You took it upon yourself to undertake the Rite of Thorns? To spill blood in this sacred place?
62.context: NodeContext: Reading the riot act to Kagha

18.speaker: Halsin
18.text: It would have been easier if you just died, Kagha. Now I have to hear your excuses instead.

30.speaker: Kagha
30.text: An error most grave, Master. I beg your grace.

19.speaker: Halsin
19.text: Grace is bestowed by nature, not me.

1.speaker: Halsin
1.text: You will stay, as a novice anew. You have forgotten the ways of the druids, the natural order of things.

84.speaker: Halsin
84.text: It is up to you to prove the lessons have been learned once more.
84.context: NodeContext: 'I hope you've learned your lesson'

6.speaker: Kagha
6.text: So as you say, and so it is done, Master.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bows and steps back from HalsinNodeContext: Kagha accepts her punishment offers a slight bow and retreats from Halsin

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Are you mad? Kagha's a traitor.
20.context: NodeContext: Explaining his reasoning to the player

31.speaker: Halsin
31.text: A dreadful misdeed - one she will never live down. But the grove still needs her passion.
31.context: NodeContext: Explaining his reasoning to the player

63.speaker: Kagha
63.text: It was an accident! She stole the idol - we were overzealous, yes, but -
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha slinks away after Halsin condemns her, He watches her go, before acknowledging the player, his temper softening.

23.speaker: Halsin
23.text: There is no we. You were the driving force behind this madness. Now it stops.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha slinks away after Halsin condemns her, He watches her go, before acknowledging the player, his temper softening.

88.speaker: Halsin
88.text: As for the idol? It's nothing compared to a life. A mere object, next to one of nature's creations.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha slinks away after Halsin condemns her, He watches her go, before acknowledging the player, his temper softening.

48.speaker: Halsin
48.text: I cannot absolve you, even if you are repentant.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha slinks away after Halsin condemns her, He watches her go, before acknowledging the player, his temper softening.

40.speaker: Halsin
40.text: The girl's parents should have decided your fate, but they perished. Instead, nature will judge you.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha slinks away after Halsin condemns her, He watches her go, before acknowledging the player, his temper softening.

85.speaker: Halsin
85.text: You are banished from this place - banished from everywhere the Oak Father's creations thrive.
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha slinks away after Halsin condemns her, He watches her go, before acknowledging the player, his temper softening.

70.speaker: Halsin
70.text: You are an enemy of nature, to be shunned until you redeem yourself or die. Now go.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha slinks away after Halsin condemns her, He watches her go, before acknowledging the player, his temper softening.

38.speaker: Halsin
38.text: You are an enemy of nature, to be shunned until you redeem yourself or die. Now go.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha slinks away after Halsin condemns her, He watches her go, before acknowledging the player, his temper softening.

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: Apologies for that ugliness. A more bitter homecoming than I would have wished, but at least the grove stands, thanks to you.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha slinks away after Halsin condemns her, He watches her go, before acknowledging the player, his temper softening.

56.speaker: Halsin
56.text: Apologies for that ugliness. A more bitter homecoming than I would have wished, but at least the grove stands, thanks to you.
56.context: NodeContext: Knowing - referring to the player's tadpole problem

43.speaker: Halsin
43.text: Apologies for that ugliness. A more bitter homecoming than I would have wished, but at least the grove stands, thanks to you.
43.context: NodeContext: Knowing - referring to the player's tadpole problem

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Kagha had that coming to her. Well done.
36.context: NodeContext: Knowing - referring to the player's tadpole problem

7.speaker: Halsin
7.text: Well done? No... this shouldn't have been necessary in the first place. I failed.
7.context: NodeContext: Knowing - referring to the player's tadpole problem

44.speaker: Halsin
44.text: Consider it in the past now. We must look forward.
44.context: NodeContext: Knowing - referring to the player's tadpole problem

4.speaker: Halsin
4.text: The grove stands. Nature prevails. I owe you my thanks - and an introduction.
4.context: NodeContext: Knowing - referring to the player's tadpole problem

60.speaker: Halsin
60.text: I am Halsin - First Druid of the Emerald Grove... and I sense you have a problem you seek my help with.
60.context: NodeContext: Knowing - referring to the player's tadpole problem

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Yes. I have a mind flayer parasite inside my head. I want your help removing it.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: ...That problem. You're infected with the mind flayer spawn, aren't you? Oak Father preserve you, child.
107.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

95.speaker: Halsin
95.text: ...That problem. You're infected with the mind flayer spawn, aren't you? Oak Father preserve you, child.
95.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

59.speaker: Halsin
59.text: ...It's true. I can feel it right now. Oak Father preserve you, child.
59.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

87.speaker: Halsin
87.text: But... something's different. You're aware of the monster inside you. You don't bow to the Absolute, like the True Souls do...
87.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

3.speaker: Halsin
3.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

64.speaker: Player
64.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I escaped from an illithid ship after being infected. Maybe the process was interrupted.
24.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

15.speaker: Halsin
15.text: Perhaps... but I wouldn't want to place all my faith in blind luck.
15.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

76.speaker: Halsin
76.text: It's no coincidence that we found each other, I'll wager? You're after a cure for this parasite.
76.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

73.speaker: Halsin
73.text: Someone is using very powerful magic to modify these tadpoles. They are using them to exert control over the infected.
73.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

11.speaker: Halsin
11.text: I'm sorry to say, I can't undo that magic. I can't cure you. But that doesn't mean I can't help.
11.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

79.speaker: Halsin
79.text: At the goblin camp, I hoped to find a way to remove the tadpoles. I failed - but I did find the next best thing. I found out where they come from.
79.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

103.speaker: Halsin
103.text: I will do what I can to help you. Let us speak tomorrow - you and I both have matters to see to first.
103.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

8.speaker: Halsin
8.text: As for what you've done for the grove, speak to Rath. He will see to your reward.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I don't know what you mean. What problem?

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Wait - how did you get here?

91.speaker: Halsin
91.text: I was an unwilling guest of the goblins - but your efforts left them in disarray and I was able to escape.

53.speaker: Halsin
53.text: The grove stands. Nature prevails. And again, I am in your debt.
53.context: NodeContext: Referring to one of his underlings

68.speaker: Halsin
68.text: Speak to Rath - he will reward you for your efforts.
68.context: NodeContext: Referring to one of his underlings

50.speaker: Player
50.text: What about my problem? I need help.
50.context: NodeContext: This is a much anticipated converation that he's aluding to.

89.speaker: Halsin
89.text: Soon. Remember the dangers I told you about - there'll be plenty of time to face them.
89.context: NodeContext: This is a much anticipated converation that he's aluding to.

75.speaker: Halsin
75.text: Take tonight to rest, recuperate - celebrate. Tomorrow, we can strike out.

52.speaker: Halsin
52.text: Take tonight to rest, recuperate -celebrate. Tomorrow, I'll join your camp so I can help with the trials yet to come.

57.speaker: Halsin
57.text: Tomorrow morning, we shall discuss what is to come.
57.context: NodeContext: This is a much anticipated converation that he's aluding to.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I hope this grove of yours is worth the bloodshed.
2.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I hope this grove of yours was worth the bloodshed.
12.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

61.speaker: Halsin
61.text: Believe me, it is. The span of a mortal life isn't enough to grasp the importance of this place. Its roots touch everything.

13.speaker: Player
13.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

99.speaker: Halsin
99.text: The journey to Moonrise Towers, and all the dangers that that entails.
99.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

98.speaker: Halsin
98.text: But that's tomorrow's problem. Take some time for yourself tonight - rest, celebrate. Come morning, I'll be by your side.

0.speaker: Halsin
0.text: Rest. Heal. Celebrate if you wish. Mourn if you must. Come morning, we shall discuss delivering you from your parasite.
0.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I watched that child die because of her. She deserved far worse than that.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: A child died because of her? She deserved far worse than that.

83.speaker: Halsin
83.text: Her punishment is only just beginning, trust me.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: You overreacted. The child's death was an accident.

86.speaker: Halsin
86.text: Please. Don't sully the gratitude I feel towards you by making excuses for Kagha. My choice was clear.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Neither of us saw what happened before - maybe the child's death wasn't her fault.

16.speaker: Halsin
16.text: Nature will determine your fate - whatever happens to you next, know that it is the Oak Father's will.

101.speaker: Halsin
101.text: Now get out of my sight. There is nothing more to be said.

102.speaker: Halsin
102.text: Now get out of my sight. There is nothing more to be said.

22.speaker: Kagha
22.text: I owe you nothing. Goblins swarmed us like roaches while you stumbled after the past.

82.speaker: Kagha
82.text: You chose to abandon us. I chose to protect us!

72.speaker: Halsin
72.text: Silence. The rite has been ended.
72.context: NodeContext: Forceful. He's heard enough from her.

25.speaker: Halsin
25.text: I will allow you to stay. But consider yourself a novice anew. You have forgotten the ways of the druids - our place in the natural order.

69.speaker: Halsin
69.text: You shall learn it all once again, right here. Backslide, and nature's fury will crush you.

10.speaker: Kagha
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: She gives a reluctant bow and retreats from HalsinNodeContext: Not happy. Said through clenched teeth. She gives a reluctant bow and retreats from Halsin

74.speaker: Player
74.text: That's all? She tried to imprison a child.
74.context: NodeContext: Explaining his reasoning to the player

100.speaker: Halsin
100.text: A misjudgement - one that should weigh heavily upon her. But the grove still needs her passion.
100.context: NodeContext: Explaining his reasoning to the player

94.speaker: Player
94.text: You'll have your hands full with her. She shows great spirit, to put it mildly.
94.context: NodeContext: 'I'll make a druid of Kagha yet'

105.speaker: Halsin
105.text: She shows great insolence. But time will humble her - and the grove still needs her.
105.context: NodeContext: 'I'll make a druid of Kagha yet'

33.speaker: Player
33.text: No need to be so harsh. Kagha acted out of concern.
33.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

5.speaker: Halsin
5.text: Misplaced, self-important concern. She must learn to respect the balance of all things. But the grove still needs her.
5.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

51.speaker: Halsin
51.text: You will soon see why. But enough of that for now - I owe you my thanks.
51.context: NodeContext: There's a little foreboding hidden in these phrases. A lot hinges on what he'll tell us tomorrow.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Such mercy is a show of weakness. You're tainting a hard-won victory.
46.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

42.speaker: Halsin
42.text: No doubt you'd have me flay her or cast her into a spiked pit. But the grove needs druids.
42.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

92.speaker: Player
92.text: The fire of ambition is in her very blood - and cruel blood is a life companion.
92.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

66.speaker: Halsin
66.text: There is naught a clear and meditative mind cannot overcome. After we stray, we return to the fold, having learnt to do better. And in the fold, Kagha is needed.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: You were too lenient. There's bad blood between tieflings and druids because of her.
34.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

81.speaker: Halsin
81.text: Spilled blood will not right bad blood. Allow me to deal with my own - I still have need of her.
81.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

96.speaker: Player
96.text: You should turn her over to my kin for judgement. Bad blood still lingers.
96.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Is such mercy wise? She's strayed from your teachings once already.
9.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

26.speaker: Halsin
26.text: She knows now what cavorting in the shadows brings her. She will not stray again. Besides, this is no time to lose a promising druid.
26.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Kagha was not acting on her own - she was under the influence of Shadow Druids.

29.speaker: Halsin
29.text: I was going to show leniency, but Kagha... a child is dead because of you.

54.speaker: Kagha
54.text: A thief is dead - she stole the idol, befouled the grove!

37.speaker: Halsin
37.text: Enough. If anyone befouled this place, it is you - by sowing division, hatred - death.

17.speaker: Halsin
17.text: You show no pity, no remorse. I cannot absolve you.

71.speaker: Halsin
71.text: You took it upon yourself to undertake the Rite of Thorns? I ought to exile you from this place. Forever.
71.context: NodeContext: Reading the riot act to Kagha

93.speaker: Halsin
93.text: Instead, I shall listen to the explanation that you owe me.
93.context: NodeContext: 'I'm going to give you a chance to say your piece'
